raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Gamma fiber", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "Stretch fibers in striated muscle refer to muscle spindles, which are innervated by gamma motor neurons (gamma fibers). These fibers adjust the sensitivity of the muscle spindle to stretch. A delta fibers and C fibers are sensory fibers associated with pain and temperature, not muscle spindle innervation. 'Unmyelinated fiber' is too vague and not specific to stretch fibers.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
